item.description:
Join us for a tour of the West Barnstable Conservation area, also known as the Trail of Tears. (Map of the area.) Breakfast at Marshland Restaurant on Route 6a in Sandwich at 8:00 if you are able.

Barnstable - Barnstable Conservation (B3B)

Activity:Hiking
Status:OPEN Meet at transmission line on Service Road. Take Rt 6 to Rt. 149S and R on Service Road for 200 yds. Walk on Trail of Tears to Sandwich town line and return. Meet at 9:15 am for 9:30 am start , 3 hours.

Larger view of map of area at left available here.

 

Difficulty:B3B (5-8 miles at moderate pace over strenous terrain.)

Offered By:Southeastern Massachusetts

Leader:Peter Selig 508-432-7656 (Email this contact person.)

Bring water and snacks and wear good boots.

This is an AMC hike led by an AMC leader. Dogs are not allowed on AMC hikes.  Pre-registration with the AMC is not required for this activity. However, you may wish to contact the listed AMC leader if you have any questions about the hike.  More info about the AMC is available at www.outdoors.org (Contact us for questions about the breakfast.)
item.how_to_find_us: Exit 5 off Route 6. Immediate right after eastbound exit on to Service Road south for 200 yards to parking area.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: West Barnstable Conservation Area with AMC
